meanings.definition: To wrap or cover with something
meanings.sent1: She enjoys bewrapping gifts with colorful paper.
meanings.sent2: He carefully bewraps the fragile item to protect it during shipping.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat started bewrapping itself in toilet paper.
meanings.sent4: The fog bewrapped the city in a mysterious cloak.
meanings.sent5: The magician bewrapped the audience in a sense of wonder with his tricks.

meanings.definition: To envelop or enclose in wrapping
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar bewraps itself in a cocoon before transforming into a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: She bewrapped the sandwich in foil to keep it fresh for lunch.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled as they tried bewrapping each other in streamers.
meanings.sent4: The darkness bewrapped the room in an eerie silence.
meanings.sent5: The artist bewrapped the sculpture in a protective layer of bubble wrap.

meanings.definition: The act of wrapping or covering something
meanings.sent1: Her bewrapping of the present was neat and precise.
meanings.sent2: The bewrapping of the building in lights signaled the start of the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The bewrapping of the tree in tinsel made it sparkle like a disco ball.
meanings.sent4: The bewrapping of the book in a beautiful cover caught the eye of many readers.
meanings.sent5: The bewrapping of the car in a giant bow made it a memorable gift.
